stmt.origin: eqtri(cdm(cres(c0, crn(c1))), cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)), cin(crn(c1), cdm(c0)))

body.origin:
|- wceq(cdm(cres(c0, crn(c1))), cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)))
-| wceq(cdm(cres(c0, crn(c1))), cin(crn(c1), cdm(c0)))
-| wceq(cin(crn(c1), cdm(c0)), cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ dom((c0 |` ran(c1)))=(dom(c0)⋂ ran(c1))
⊣ dom((c0 |` ran(c1)))=(ran(c1)⋂ dom(c0))
⊣ (ran(c1)⋂ dom(c0))=(dom(c0)⋂ ran(c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wceq(ccom(c0, c1), emptycls), wceq(cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)), emptycls))
-| wceq(cdm(cres(c0, crn(c1))), cin(crn(c1), cdm(c0)))
-| wceq(cin(crn(c1), cdm(c0)), cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∘ c1)= ∅ ↔(dom(c0)⋂ ran(c1))= ∅)
⊣ dom((c0 |` ran(c1)))=(ran(c1)⋂ dom(c0))
⊣ (ran(c1)⋂ dom(c0))=(dom(c0)⋂ ran(c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wceq(ccom(c0, c1), emptycls), wceq(cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)), emptycls))
-| wceq(cin(crn(c1), cdm(c0)), cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)))
|- wb(wceq(ccom(c0, c1), emptycls), wceq(cin(cdm(c0), crn(c1)), emptycls))

comment: A composition of two relations is empty iff there is no overlap between the range of the second and the domain of the first. Useful in combination with ~ coundi and ~ coundir to prune meaningless terms in the result. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 8-Oct-2014.)
